Nasal septoplasty.context: Nasal septoplasty, bilateral submucous resection of the inferior turbinates, and tonsillectomy and resection of soft palate.

bilateral submucous resection of the inf.context: Nasal septoplasty, bilateral submucous resection of the inferior turbinates, and tonsillectomy and resection of soft palate.

tonsillectomy and resection of soft pala.context: Nasal septoplasty, bilateral submucous resection of the inferior turbinates, and tonsillectomy and resection of soft palate.

Nasal septal deviation with bilateral in.context: Nasal septal deviation with bilateral inferior turbinate hypertrophy.

Edema to the uvula and soft palate.context: Edema to the uvula and soft palate.

38-year-old male.context: Chris is a very nice 38-year-old male with nasal septal deviation and bilateral inferior turbinate hypertrophy causing nasal obstruction.

nasal obstruction.context: Chris is a very nice 38-year-old male with nasal septal deviation and bilateral inferior turbinate hypertrophy causing nasal obstruction.

persistent tonsillitis with hypertrophy.context: He also has persistent tonsillitis with hypertrophy and tonsillolith and halitosis.

tremendous edema to his posterior palate.context: He also has developed tremendous edema to his posterior palate and uvula, which is causing choking.

choking.context: He also has developed tremendous edema to his posterior palate and uvula, which is causing choking.

general endotracheal anesthesia.context: After adequate general endotracheal anesthesia was administered, the right and left nasal septal mucosa and right and left inferior turbinates were anesthetized with 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine using approximately 10 mL.

1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine.context: After adequate general endotracheal anesthesia was administered, the right and left nasal septal mucosa and right and left inferior turbinates were anesthetized with 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine using approximately 10 mL.

Afrin-soaked pledgets.context: Afrin-soaked pledgets were placed in the nasal cavity bilaterally.

pHisoHex.context: The face was prepped with pHisoHex and draped in a sterile fashion.

hemitransfixion incision.context: A hemitransfixion incision was performed on the left with a #15 blade and submucoperichondrial and mucoperiosteal flap was raised with the Cottle elevator.

deviated portion of the nasal septal car.context: The deviated portion of the nasal septal cartilage and bone was removed with a Takahashi forceps, and a large inferior septal spur was removed with a V-chisel.

4-0 Vicryl.context: Once the septum was reduced in the midline, the hemitransfixion incision was closed with a 4-0 Vicryl in an interrupted fashion.

bacitracin ointment.context: The turbinates were then covered with bacitracin ointment after cauterizing them and bacitracin ointment soaked Doyle splints were placed in the right and left nares and secured anteriorly to the columella with a 3-0 nylon suture.

Doyle splints.context: The turbinates were then covered with bacitracin ointment after cauterizing them and bacitracin ointment soaked Doyle splints were placed in the right and left nares and secured anteriorly to the columella with a 3-0 nylon suture.

McIvor mouth gag.context: A McIvor mouth gag was applied.

Bovie electrocautery.context: The left tonsil was grasped with a curved Allis forceps, retracted medially, and the anterior tonsillar pillar was incised with Bovie electrocautery.

extremely edematous portion of soft pala.context: The extremely edematous portion of soft palate was resected using a right angle clamp and right angle scissor and was closed with 3-0 Vicryl in a figure-of-eight interrupted fashion.

Copious saline irrigation.context: Copious saline irrigation of the oral cavity was then performed.

no further identifiable bleeding.context: There was no further identifiable bleeding at the termination of the procedure.

estimated blood loss was less than 10 mL.context: The estimated blood loss was less than 10 mL.
